page.title: 01PLUMSTEAD/ABBEY WOOD AREA
page.content:
The area covered varies from the medieval ruins of Lesnes Abbey and the fossil beds of Lesnes Woods in the East to the urban Victorian terraces and sixties tower blocks of Plumstead in the West; from the marshland and the newtown of Thamesmead at present under construction bordering the river Thames to to the north to the suburban residential area in the south.
The area has been predominantly residential from the turn of the century with the building of the Abbey Wood Estate (in the fifties) and Thamesmead (begun in the sixties) as advances in building technology made possible building on the marshland to the North.
